alert.note: Alert for Appling; Wayne (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 8:43PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Wayne and east central Appling Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 841 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Surrency. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. Based on radar, rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches have occurred. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Surrency. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
